meanings.definition: flintheads: plural noun, a derogatory term for a group of people who are stubborn or resistant to change
meanings.sent1: The flintheads in our neighborhood never want to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The teacher called the students flintheads when they refused to participate in the group activity.
meanings.sent3: The flintheads at the office always stick to their old ways of doing things.
meanings.sent4: Her family members were like flintheads, unwilling to accept any changes to their traditions.
meanings.sent5: The image of flintheads standing still while the world moved around them was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: flintheads: verb, to act in a stubborn or resistant manner
meanings.sent1: She flintheads whenever someone suggests a different approach.
meanings.sent2: Don't flintheads when it comes to trying out new experiences.
meanings.sent3: He always flintheads when it's time to change his daily routine.
meanings.sent4: The old dog flintheads against taking a bath every time.
meanings.sent5: The child would flintheads whenever bedtime was mentioned, wanting to stay up longer.
